Trump imposes new tariffs, but only from August 7
subhead: The US president signed the executive order for the new tariffs on Thursday evening. Initially expected to take effect today, at the deadline set by Washington for the completion of negotiations, they will now come into force in six days.

Locals in Mexico City rise up against gentrification
subhead: Soaring rents in the Mexican capital have driven hundreds of residents into the streets to protest against property speculation, a shortage of housing and the arrival of 'digital nomads' in certain neighborhoods.

headline: Trump envoy to inspect Gaza aid as pressure mounts on Israel
subhead: The White House announced that US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff had a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday ahead of his visit to Gaza the following day. Israel is under mounting international pressure to agree to a ceasefire and allow the world to flood Gaza with food.

headline: 'Dracula': Luc Besson's visual bloodbath filled with clichés and problematic female characters
subhead: The director, aiming for a sweeping romantic epic, instead delivers a film packed with clichés and visual excess.

headline: Music festivals in France face fragile economics and unsustainable future
subhead: Businessman Matthieu Pigasse and the group AEG Presents have acquired the We Love Green festival, despite two-thirds of contemporary music events in France ending 2024 in deficit.

In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
subhead: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.

headline: In Brazil, the free and instant mobile payment system Pix challenges US dominance
subhead: Launched by the Central Bank of Brazil, this system is now used more than credit cards and cash. Its popularity is so great that WhatsApp had to abandon a payment system it wanted to launch locally.

headline: Kristi Noem, the face of the Trump administration's anti-immigrant raids
subhead: Nicknamed 'Homeland Barbie,' the US secretary of homeland security has repeatedly staged shows of force before cameras, in a style that has become characteristic of the women in the president's inner circle.
